title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: At the end of the month, after taking a grateful farewell of Mr. Fieldand his partners, I set sail for Leith with my stock of castings,and reached Edinburgh in due time. In order to proceed with theconstruction of my machine tools, I rented a small piece of land at OldBroughton. It was at the rear of my worthy friend George Douglass'ssmall foundry, and was only about five minutes' walk from my father'shouse.
